content: Are carrots good for your eyesight because they contain vitamin A?

Yes, carrots are indeed good for your eyesight, and one of the reasons is that they are rich in vitamin A. Vitamin A is essential for maintaining healthy vision, and a deficiency in this vitamin can lead to night blindness and other vision problems. Carrots contain beta-carotene, which is a precursor to vitamin A, meaning that your body can convert it into vitamin A as needed. So, including carrots in your diet can contribute to overall eye health.
